intro: Anil pascuorum, commonly known as field forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Anil pascuorum blooms from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
